xwikidoc.title: Administrator's Guide
xwikidoc.content:
Everything you want to know about administrating XWiki, from Installation to backups and more.
== Admin Topics ==
; **[[Installation>>Installation]]** : Learn how to install XWiki on your machine or upgrade an existing installation.
; **[[Upgrade>>Upgrade]]** : Learn how to upgrade your XWiki installation to keep it up-to-date.
; **[[Configuration>>Configuration]]** : Learn how to configure and tune XWiki in various ways.
; **[[Backup/Restore>>Backup]]** : Learn how to backup and restore your wiki.
; **[[Virtual Wikis>>Virtualization]]** : You can run multiple XWiki services on a single XWiki server using a Virtual configuration; without needing a supercharged server. Here's how to do it.
; **[[Access a wiki>>AccessWiki]]** : Learn the different ways to target a wiki in the url.
; **[[Applications installation into wiki-farm>>ApplicationInstallationIntoWikiFarm]]** : Learn the peculiarities of application installation on wiki-farm
; **[[Import/Export>>ImportExport]]** : Import and Export pages to and from your wikis.
; **[[Security]]** : Tune the configuration to secure your wiki.
; **[[Access Rights]]** : Define which users should be allowed to view and interact with your wiki.
; **[[User Management]]** : Add, Edit, Delete and manage users.
; **[[Group Management]]** : Add, Edit, Delete and manage groups.
; **[[Skins>>Skins]]** : Learn how to use a different skin and even how to create a complete new one.
; **[[Encoding]]** : Learn how to configure XWiki for UTF-8 or any other non-default encoding.
; **[[Authentication]]** : Configure XWiki's authentication mechanism (Database, LDAP, custom implementation, etc).
; **[[Logging]]** : Configure XWiki's logging system.
; **[[Database Administration]]** : Administer your XWiki database.
; **[[Attachments]]** : Configure how attachments are stored, whether version history will be kept and set size limits.
; **[[Performance Tuning>>Performances]]** : Improve your wiki's performance.
; **[[URL resolution]]** : Learn how XWiki parse and interpret given URL.
; **[[Clustering>>Clustering]]** : You can run multiple instances of XWiki on the same database to be able to do load balancing. Here's how to do it.
; **[[Monitoring]]** : Monitor a running instance using JMX
